n.c: There is no exam in this course.

Students must write an academic essay of at least 1,000 words. Because the course is planned to be in-person in the classroom, reports must be submitted by printed paper and by email in Microsoft Word format, submitted to the instructor BEFORE THE BEGINNING of the last class day. Reports turned in after this deadline WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. Students not completing a report or submitting a report late are not eligible to pass the course.  All reports will be checked for plagiarism. Because plagiarism (and the requirements for writing the report) will be explained in the course, students found plagiarizing will automatically fail the course.

Students will receive grades for (1) attendance, (2) punctuality, (3) participation, and (4) responsibility.  There is a strict attendance policy for this course.  Part of the responsibility grade comes from students (a) bringing all course materials to class each lesson and (b) downloading and printing the lecture quizzes. Quizzes may be graded (and thus become an added element of the responsibility grade) depending on how well students display responsibility for their learning in the course.

n.c: There is no exam in this course.

Students must write an academic essay of at least 1,000 words. Because the course is planned to be in-person in the classroom, reports must be submitted by printed paper and by email in Microsoft Word format, submitted to the instructor BEFORE THE BEGINNING of the last class day. Reports turned in after this deadline WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. Students not completing a report or submitting a report late are not eligible to pass the course.  All reports will be checked for plagiarism. Because plagiarism (and the requirements for writing the report) will be explained in the course, students found plagiarizing will automatically fail the course.

Students will receive grades for (1) attendance, (2) punctuality, (3) participation, and (4) responsibility.  There is a strict attendance policy for this course.  Part of the responsibility grade comes from students (a) bringing all course materials to class each lesson and (b) downloading and printing the lecture quizzes. Quizzes may be graded (and thus become an added element of the responsibility grade) depending on how well students display responsibility for their learning in the course.
